00002  * \file RandomCanonical.hpp

00015   "$Id: 089706ef45c19a02bdf104764ac56d36596f3a21 $"

00017 #include <bitset>
00018 #include <RandomLib/RandomPower2.hpp>
00019 #include <RandomLib/RandomEngine.hpp>
00020 
00021 namespace RandomLib {
00022   /**
00023    * \brief Generate random integers, reals, and booleans.
00024    *
00025    * Use the random bits from Generator to produce random integers of various
00026    * sizes, random reals with various precisions, a random probability, etc.
00027    * RandomCanonical assumes that Generator produces random results as 32-bit
00028    * quantities (of type uint32_t) via Generator::Ran32(), 64-bit quantities
00029    * (of type uint64_t) via Generator::Ran64(), and in "natural" units of
00030    * Generator::width bits (of type Generator::result_type) via
00031    * Generator::Ran().
00032    *
00033    * For the most part this class uses Ran() when needing \e width or fewer
00034    * bits, otherwise it uses Ran64().  However, when \e width = 64, the
00035    * resulting code is RandomCanonical::Unsigned(\e n) is inefficient because
00036    * of the 64-bit arithmetic.  For this reason RandomCanonical::Unsigned(\e n)
00037    * uses Ran32() if less than 32 bits are required (even though this results
00038    * in more numbers being produced by the Generator).
00039    *
00040    * This class has been tested with the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of MT19937
00041    * and SFMT19937.  Other random number generators could be used provided that
00042    * they provide a whole number of random bits so that Ran() is uniformly
00043    * distributed in [0,2<sup><i>w</i></sup>).  Probably some modifications
00044    * would be needed if \e w is not 32 or 64.
00045    *
00046    * @tparam Generator the type of the underlying generator.
00047    **********************************************************************/
00048   template<class Generator>
00049   class RandomCanonical : public Generator {
00050   public:
00051     /**
00052      * The type of operator()().
00053      **********************************************************************/
00054     typedef typename Generator::result_type result_type;
00055     /**
00056      * The type of elements of Seed().
00057      **********************************************************************/
00058     typedef typename RandomSeed::seed_type seed_type;
00059     enum {
00060       /**
00061        * The number of random bits in result_type.
00062        **********************************************************************/
00063       width = Generator::width
00064     };
00065 
00066     /**
00067      * \name Constructors which set the seed
00068      **********************************************************************/
00069     ///@{
00070     /**
00071      * Initialize from a vector.
00072      *
00073      * @tparam IntType the integral type of the elements of the vector.
00074      * @param[in] v the vector of elements.
00075      **********************************************************************/
00076     template<typename IntType>
00077     explicit RandomCanonical(const std::vector<IntType>& v) : Generator(v) {}
00078     /**
00079      * Initialize from a pair of iterator setting seed to [\e a, \e b)
00080      *
00081      * @tparam InputIterator the type of the iterator.
00082      * @param[in] a the beginning iterator.
00083      * @param[in] b the ending iterator.
00084      **********************************************************************/
00085     template<typename InputIterator>
00086     RandomCanonical(InputIterator a, InputIterator b) : Generator(a, b) {}
00087     /**
00088      * Initialize with seed [\e n]
00089      *
00090      * @param[in] n the new seed to use.
00091      **********************************************************************/
00092     explicit RandomCanonical(seed_type n);
00093     /**
00094      * Initialize with seed [].  This can be followed by a call to Reseed() to
00095      * select a unique seed.
00096      **********************************************************************/
00097     RandomCanonical() : Generator() {}
00098     /**
00099      * Initialize from a string.  See RandomCanonical::StringToVector
00100      *
00101      * @param[in] s the string to be decoded into a seed.
00102      **********************************************************************/
00103     explicit RandomCanonical(const std::string& s) : Generator(s) {}
00104     ///@}
00105 
00106     /**
00107      * \name Member functions returning integers
00108      **********************************************************************/
00109     ///@{
00110     /**
00111      * Return a raw result in [0, 2<sup><i>w</i></sup>) from the
00112      * underlying Generator.
00113      *
00114      * @return a <i>w</i>-bit random number.
00115      **********************************************************************/
00116     result_type operator()() throw() { return Generator::Ran(); }
00117 
00118     /**
00119      * A random integer in [0, \e n).  This allows a RandomCanonical object to
00120      * be passed to those standard template library routines that require
00121      * random numbers.  E.g.,
00122      * \code
00123      *   RandomCanonical r;
00124      *   int a[] = {0, 1, 2, 3, 4};
00125      *   std::random_shuffle(a, a+5, r);
00126      * \endcode
00127      *
00128      * @param[in] n the upper end of the interval.  The upper end of the
00129      *   interval is open, so \e n is never returned.
00130      * @return the random integer in [0, \e n).
00131      **********************************************************************/
00132     result_type operator()(result_type n) throw()
00133     { return Integer<result_type>(n); }
00134 
00135     // Integer results (binary range)
00136 
00137     /**
00138      * A random integer of type IntType in [0, 2<sup><i>b</i></sup>).
00139      *
00140      * @tparam IntType the integer type of the returned random numbers.
00141      * @tparam bits how many random bits to return.
00142      * @return the random result.
00143      **********************************************************************/
00144     template<typename IntType, int bits> IntType Integer() throw() {
00145       // A random integer of type IntType in [0, 2^bits)
00146       STATIC_ASSERT(std::numeric_limits<IntType>::is_integer &&
00147                     std::numeric_limits<IntType>::radix == 2,
00148                     "Integer<T,b>(): bad integer type IntType");
00149       // Check that we have enough digits in Ran64
00150       STATIC_ASSERT(bits > 0 && bits <= std::numeric_limits<IntType>::digits &&
00151                     bits <= 64, "Integer<T,b>(): invalid value for bits");
00152       // Prefer masking to shifting so that we don't have to worry about sign
00153       // extension (a non-issue, because Ran/64 are unsigned?).
00154       return bits <= width ?
00155         IntType(Generator::Ran() & Generator::mask
00156                 >> (bits <= width ? width - bits : 0)) :
00157         IntType(Generator::Ran64() & u64::mask >> (64 - bits));
00158     }
00159 
00160     /**
00161      * A random integer in [0, 2<sup><i>b</i></sup>).
00162      *
00163      * @tparam bits how many random bits to return.
00164      * @return the random result.
00165      **********************************************************************/
00166     template<int bits>
00167     result_type Integer() throw() { return Integer<result_type, bits>(); }
00168 
00169     /**
00170      * A random integer of type IntType in
00171      * [std::numeric_limits<IntType>::min(), std::numeric_limits::max()].
00172      *
00173      * @tparam IntType the integer type of the returned random numbers.
00174      * @return the random result.
00175      **********************************************************************/
00176     template<typename IntType> IntType Integer() throw();
00177 
00178     /**
00179      * A random result_type in [0, std::numeric_limits<result_type>::max()].
00180      *
00181      * @return the random result.
00182      **********************************************************************/
00183     result_type Integer() throw()
00184     { return Integer<result_type>(); }
00185 
00186     // Integer results (finite range)
00187 
00188     /**
00189      * A random integer of type IntType in [0, \e n). \e Excludes \e n.  If \e
00190      * n == 0, treat as std::numeric_limits::max() + 1.  If \e n < 0, return 0.
00191      * Compare RandomCanonical::Integer<int>(0) which returns a result in
00192      * [0,2<sup>31</sup>) with RandomCanonical::Integer<int>() which returns a
00193      * result in [-2<sup>31</sup>,2<sup>31</sup>).
00194      *
00195      * @tparam IntType the integer type of the returned random numbers.
00196      * @param[in] n the upper end of the semi-open interval.
00197      * @return the random result in [0, \e n).
00198      **********************************************************************/
00199     template<typename IntType> IntType Integer(IntType n) throw();
00200     /**
00201      * A random integer of type IntType in Closed interval [0, \e n].  \e
00202      * Includes \e n.  If \e n < 0, return 0.
00203      *
00204      * @tparam IntType the integer type of the returned random numbers.
00205      * @param[in] n the upper end of the closed interval.
00206      * @return the random result in [0, \e n].
00207      **********************************************************************/
00208     template<typename IntType> IntType IntegerC(IntType n) throw();
00209     /**
00210      * A random integer of type IntType in Closed interval [\e m, \e n].  \e
00211      * Includes both endpoints.  If \e n < \e m, return \e m.
00212      *
00213      * @tparam IntType the integer type of the returned random numbers.
00214      * @param[in] m the lower end of the closed interval.
00215      * @param[in] n the upper end of the closed interval.
00216      * @return the random result in [\e m, \e n].
00217      **********************************************************************/
00218     template<typename IntType> IntType IntegerC(IntType m, IntType n) throw();
00219     ///@}
00220 
00221     /**
00222      * \name Member functions returning real fixed-point numbers
00223      **********************************************************************/
00224     ///@{
00225     /**
00226      * In the description of the functions FixedX returning \ref fixed
00227      * "fixed-point" numbers, \e u is a random real number uniformly
00228      * distributed in (0, 1), \e p is the precision, and \e h =
00229      * 1/2<sup><i>p</i></sup>.  Each of the functions come in three variants,
00230      * e.g.,
00231      *   - RandomCanonical::Fixed<RealType,p>() --- return \ref fixed
00232      *     "fixed-point" real of type RealType, precision \e p;
00233      *   - RandomCanonical::Fixed<RealType>() --- as above with \e p =
00234      *     std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits;
00235      *   - RandomCanonical::Fixed() --- as above with RealType = double.
00236      *
00237      * See the \ref reals "summary" for a comparison of the functions.
00238      *
00239      * Return \e i \e h with \e i in [0,2<sup><i>p</i></sup>) by rounding \e u
00240      * down to the previous \ref fixed "fixed" real.  Result is in default
00241      * interval [0,1).
00242      *
00243      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00244      * @tparam prec the precision of the returned random numbers.
00245      * @return the random result.
00246      **********************************************************************/
00247     template<typename RealType, int prec> RealType Fixed() throw() {
00248       // RandomCanonical reals in [0, 1).  Results are of the form i/2^prec for
00249       // integer i in [0,2^prec).
00250       STATIC_ASSERT(!std::numeric_limits<RealType>::is_integer &&
00251                     std::numeric_limits<RealType>::radix == 2,
00252                     "Fixed(): bad real type RealType");
00253       STATIC_ASSERT(prec > 0 && prec <= std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits,
00254                     "Fixed(): invalid precision");
00255       RealType x = 0;           // Accumulator
00256       int s = 0;                // How many bits so far
00257       // Let n be the loop count.  Typically prec = 24, n = 1 for float; prec =
00258       // 53, n = 2 for double; prec = 64, n = 2 for long double.  For Sun
00259       // Sparc's, we have prec = 113, n = 4 for long double.  For Windows, long
00260       // double is the same as double (prec = 53).
00261       do {
00262         s += width;
00263         x += RandomPower2::shiftf<RealType>
00264           (RealType(Generator::Ran() >> (s > prec ? s - prec : 0)),
00265            -(s > prec ? prec : s));
00266       } while (s < prec);
00267       return x;
00268     }
00269     /**
00270      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::Fixed<RealType,prec>().
00271      *
00272      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00273      * @return the random result with the full precision of RealType.
00274      **********************************************************************/
00275     template<typename RealType> RealType Fixed() throw()
00276     { return Fixed<RealType, std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits>(); }
00277     /**
00278      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::Fixed<RealType,prec>().
00279      *
00280      * @return the random double.
00281      **********************************************************************/
00282     double Fixed() throw() { return Fixed<double>(); }
00283 
00284     /**
00285      * An alias for RandomCanonical::Fixed<RealType>().  Returns a random
00286      * number of type RealType in [0,1).
00287      *
00288      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00289      * @return the random result with the full precision of RealType.
00290      **********************************************************************/
00291     template<typename RealType> RealType Real() throw()
00292     { return Fixed<RealType>(); }
00293     /**
00294      * An alias for RandomCanonical::Fixed().  Returns a random double in
00295      * [0,1).
00296      *
00297      * @return the random double.
00298      **********************************************************************/
00299     double Real() throw() { return Fixed(); }
00300 
00301     /**
00302      * Return \e i \e h with \e i in (0,2<sup><i>p</i></sup>] by rounding \e u
00303      * up to the next \ref fixed "fixed" real.  Result is in upper interval
00304      * (0,1].
00305      *
00306      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00307      * @tparam prec the precision of the returned random numbers.
00308      * @return the random result.
00309      **********************************************************************/
00310     template<typename RealType, int prec> RealType FixedU() throw()
00311     { return RealType(1) - Fixed<RealType, prec>(); }
00312     /**
00313      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::FixedU<RealType,prec>().
00314      *
00315      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00316      * @return the random result with the full precision of RealType.
00317      **********************************************************************/
00318     template<typename RealType> RealType FixedU() throw()
00319     { return FixedU<RealType, std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits>(); }
00320     /**
00321      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::FixedU<RealType,prec>().
00322      *
00323      * @return the random double.
00324      **********************************************************************/
00325     double FixedU() throw() { return FixedU<double>(); }
00326 
00327     /**
00328      * Return \e i \e h with \e i in [0,2<sup><i>p</i></sup>] by rounding \e u
00329      * to the nearest \ref fixed "fixed" real.  Result is in nearest interval
00330      * [0,1].  The probability of returning interior values is <i>h</i> while
00331      * the probability of returning the endpoints is <i>h</i>/2.
00332      *
00333      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00334      * @tparam prec the precision of the returned random numbers.
00335      * @return the random result.
00336      **********************************************************************/
00337     template<typename RealType, int prec> RealType FixedN() throw() {
00338       const RealType x = Fixed<RealType, prec>();
00339       return x || Boolean() ? x : RealType(1);
00340     }
00341     /**
00342      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::FixedN<RealType,prec>().
00343      *
00344      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00345      * @return the random result with the full precision of RealType.
00346      **********************************************************************/
00347     template<typename RealType> RealType FixedN() throw()
00348     { return FixedN<RealType, std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits>(); }
00349     /**
00350      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::FixedN<RealType,prec>().
00351      *
00352      * @return the random double.
00353      **********************************************************************/
00354     double FixedN() throw() { return FixedN<double>(); }
00355 
00356     /**
00357      * Return \e i \e h with \e i in [-2<sup><i>p</i></sup>,
00358      * 2<sup><i>p</i></sup>] by rounding 2\e u - 1 to the nearest \ref fixed
00359      * "fixed" real.  Result is in wide interval [-1,1].  The probability of
00360      * returning interior values is <i>h</i>/2 while the probability of
00361      * returning the endpoints is <i>h</i>/4.
00362      *
00363      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00364      * @tparam prec the precision of the returned random numbers.
00365      * @return the random result.
00366      **********************************************************************/
00367     template<typename RealType, int prec> RealType FixedW() throw() {
00368       // Random reals in [-1, 1].  Round random in [-1, 1] to nearest multiple
00369       // of 1/2^prec.  Results are of the form i/2^prec for integer i in
00370       // [-2^prec,2^prec].
00371       STATIC_ASSERT(!std::numeric_limits<RealType>::is_integer &&
00372                     std::numeric_limits<RealType>::radix == 2,
00373                     "FixedW(): bad real type RealType");
00374       STATIC_ASSERT(prec > 0 && prec <= std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits,
00375                     "FixedW(): invalid precision");
00376       RealType x = -RealType(1); // Accumulator
00377       int s = -1;                // How many bits so far
00378       do {
00379         s += width;
00380         x += RandomPower2::shiftf<RealType>
00381           (RealType(Generator::Ran() >> (s > prec ? s - prec : 0)),
00382            -(s > prec ? prec : s));
00383       } while (s < prec);
00384       return (x + RealType(1) != RealType(0)) || Boolean() ? x : RealType(1);
00385     }
00386     /**
00387      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::FixedW<RealType,prec>().
00388      *
00389      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00390      * @return the random result with the full precision of RealType.
00391      **********************************************************************/
00392     template<typename RealType> RealType FixedW() throw()
00393     { return FixedW<RealType, std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits>(); }
00394     /**
00395      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::FixedW<RealType,prec>().
00396      *
00397      * @return the random double.
00398      **********************************************************************/
00399     double FixedW() throw() { return FixedW<double>(); }
00400 
00401     /**
00402      * Return (<i>i</i>+1/2)\e h with \e i in [2<sup><i>p</i>-1</sup>,
00403      * 2<sup><i>p</i>-1</sup>) by rounding \e u - 1/2 to nearest offset \ref
00404      * fixed "fixed" real.  Result is in symmetric interval (-1/2,1/2).
00405      *
00406      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00407      * @tparam prec the precision of the returned random numbers.
00408      * @return the random result.
00409      **********************************************************************/
00410     template<typename RealType, int prec> RealType FixedS() throw()
00411     { return Fixed<RealType, prec>() -
00412         ( RealType(1) - RandomPower2::pow2<RealType>(-prec) ) / 2; }
00413     /**
00414      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::FixedS<RealType,prec>().
00415      *
00416      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00417      * @return the random result with the full precision of RealType.
00418      **********************************************************************/
00419     template<typename RealType> RealType FixedS() throw()
00420     { return FixedS<RealType, std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits>(); }
00421     /**
00422      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::FixedS<RealType,prec>().
00423      *
00424      * @return the random double.
00425      **********************************************************************/
00426     double FixedS() throw() { return FixedS<double>(); }
00427 
00428     /**
00429      * Return \e i \e h with \e i in (0,2<sup><i>p</i></sup>) by rounding (1 -
00430      * \e h)\e u up to next \ref fixed "fixed" real.  Result is in open
00431      * interval (0,1).
00432      *
00433      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00434      * @tparam prec the precision of the returned random numbers.
00435      * @return the random result.
00436      **********************************************************************/
00437     template<typename RealType, int prec> RealType FixedO() throw() {
00438       // A real of type RealType in (0, 1) with precision prec
00439       STATIC_ASSERT(!std::numeric_limits<RealType>::is_integer &&
00440                     std::numeric_limits<RealType>::radix == 2,
00441                     "FixedO(): bad real type RealType");
00442       STATIC_ASSERT(prec > 0 && prec <= std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits,
00443                     "FixedO(): invalid precision");
00444       RealType x;
00445       // Loop executed 2^prec/(2^prec-1) times on average.
00446       do
00447         x = Fixed<RealType, prec>();
00448       while (x == 0);
00449       return x;
00450     }
00451     /**
00452      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::FixedO<RealType,prec>().
00453      *
00454      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00455      * @return the random result with the full precision of RealType.
00456      **********************************************************************/
00457     template<typename RealType> RealType FixedO() throw()
00458     { return FixedO<RealType, std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits>(); }
00459     /**
00460      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::FixedO<RealType,prec>().
00461      *
00462      * @return the random double.
00463      **********************************************************************/
00464     double FixedO() throw() { return FixedO<double>(); }
00465 
00466     /**
00467      * Return \e i \e h with \e i in [0,2<sup><i>p</i></sup>] by rounding (1 +
00468      * \e h)\e u down to previous \ref fixed "fixed" real.  Result is in closed
00469      * interval [0,1].
00470      *
00471      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00472      * @tparam prec the precision of the returned random numbers.
00473      * @return the random result.
00474      **********************************************************************/
00475     template<typename RealType, int prec> RealType FixedC() throw() {
00476       // A real of type RealType in [0, 1] with precision prec
00477       STATIC_ASSERT(!std::numeric_limits<RealType>::is_integer &&
00478                     std::numeric_limits<RealType>::radix == 2,
00479                     "FixedC(): bad real type RealType");
00480       STATIC_ASSERT(prec > 0 && prec <= std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits,
00481                     "FixedC(): invalid precision");
00482       if (prec < width) {
00483         // Sample an integer in [0, n) where n = 2^prec + 1.  This uses the
00484         // same logic as Unsigned(n - 1).  However, unlike Unsigned, there
00485         // doesn't seem to be much of a penalty for the 64-bit arithmetic here
00486         // when result_type = unsigned long long.  Presumably this is because
00487         // the compiler can do some of the arithmetic.
00488         const result_type
00489           n = (result_type(1) << (prec < width ? prec : 0)) + 1,
00490           // Computing this instead of 2^width/n suffices, because of the form
00491           // of n.
00492           r = Generator::mask / n,
00493           m = r * n;
00494         result_type u;
00495         do
00496           u = Generator::Ran();
00497         while (u >= m);
00498         // u is rv in [0, r * n)
00499         return RandomPower2::shiftf<RealType>(RealType(u / r), -prec);
00500         // Could also special case prec < 64, using Ran64().  However the
00501         // general code below is faster.
00502       } else {                  // prec >= width
00503         // Synthesize a prec+1 bit random, Y, width bits at a time.  If number
00504         // is odd, return Fixed<RealType, prec>() (w prob 1/2); else if number
00505         // is zero, return 1 (w prob 1/2^(prec+1)); else repeat.  Normalizing
00506         // probabilities on returned results we find that Fixed<RealType,
00507         // prec>() is returned with prob 2^prec/(2^prec+1), and 1 is return
00508         // with prob 1/(2^prec+1), as required.  Loop executed twice on average
00509         // and so consumes 2rvs more than rvs for Fixed<RealType, prec>().  As
00510         // in FloatZ, do NOT try to save on calls to Ran() by using the
00511         // leftover bits from Fixed.
00512         while (true) {
00513           // If prec + 1 < width then mask x with (1 << prec + 1) - 1
00514           const result_type x = Generator::Ran(); // Low width bits of Y
00515           if (x & 1u)                             // Y odd?
00516             return Fixed<RealType, prec>(); // Prob 1/2 on each loop iteration
00517           if (x)
00518             continue;               // Y nonzero
00519           int s = prec + 1 - width; // Bits left to check (s >= 0)
00520           while (true) {
00521             if (s <= 0)         // We're done.  Y = 0
00522               // Prob 1/2^(prec+1) on each loop iteration
00523               return RealType(1); // We get here once every 60000 yrs (p = 64)!
00524             // Check the next min(s, width) bits.
00525             if (Generator::Ran() >> (s > width ? 0 : width - s))
00526               break;
00527             s -= width;         // Decrement s
00528           }
00529         }
00530       }
00531     }
00532     /**
00533      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::FixedC<RealType,prec>().
00534      *
00535      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00536      * @return the random result with the full precision of RealType.
00537      **********************************************************************/
00538     template<typename RealType> RealType FixedC() throw()
00539     { return FixedC<RealType, std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits>(); }
00540     /**
00541      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::FixedC<RealType,prec>().
00542      *
00543      * @return the random double.
00544      **********************************************************************/
00545     double FixedC() throw() { return FixedC<double>(); }
00546     ///@}
00547 
00548     /**
00549      * \name Member functions returning real floating-point numbers
00550      **********************************************************************/
00551     ///@{
00552 
00553     // The floating results produces results on a floating scale.  Here the
00554     // separation between possible results is smaller for smaller numbers.
00555 
00556     /**
00557      * In the description of the functions FloatX returning \ref floating
00558      * "floating-point" numbers, \e u is a random real number uniformly
00559      * distributed in (0, 1), \e p is the precision, and \e e is the exponent
00560      * range.  Each of the functions come in three variants, e.g.,
00561      *   - RandomCanonical::Float<RealType,p,e>() --- return \ref floating
00562      *     "floating-point" real of type RealType, precision \e p, and exponent
00563      *     range \e e;
00564      *   - RandomCanonical::Float<RealType>() --- as above with \e p =
00565      *     std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits and \e e =
00566      *     - std::numeric_limits<RealType>::min_exponent;
00567      *   - RandomCanonical::Float() --- as above with RealType = double.
00568      *
00569      * See the \ref reals "summary" for a comparison of the functions.
00570      *
00571      * Return result is in default interval [0,1) by rounding \e u down
00572      * to the previous \ref floating "floating" real.
00573      *
00574      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00575      * @tparam prec the precision of the returned random numbers.
00576      * @tparam erange the exponent range of the returned random numbers.
00577      * @return the random result.
00578      **********************************************************************/
00579     template<typename RealType, int prec, int erange> RealType Float() throw()
00580     { return FloatZ<RealType, prec, erange, false>(0, 0); }
00581     /**
00582      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::Float<RealType,prec,erange>().
00583      *
00584      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00585      * @return the random result with the full precision of RealType.
00586      **********************************************************************/
00587     template<typename RealType> RealType Float() throw() {
00588       return Float<RealType, std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits,
00589         -std::numeric_limits<RealType>::min_exponent>();
00590     }
00591     /**
00592      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::Float<RealType,prec,erange>().
00593      *
00594      * @return the random double.
00595      **********************************************************************/
00596     double Float() throw() { return Float<double>(); }
00597 
00598     /**
00599      * Return result is in upper interval (0,1] by round \e u up to the
00600      * next \ref floating "floating" real.
00601      *
00602      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00603      * @tparam prec the precision of the returned random numbers.
00604      * @tparam erange the exponent range of the returned random numbers.
00605      * @return the random result.
00606      **********************************************************************/
00607     template<typename RealType, int prec, int erange> RealType FloatU() throw()
00608     { return FloatZ<RealType, prec, erange, true>(0, 0); }
00609     /**
00610      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::FloatU<RealType,prec,erange>().
00611      *
00612      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00613      * @return the random result with the full precision of RealType.
00614      **********************************************************************/
00615     template<typename RealType> RealType FloatU() throw() {
00616       return FloatU<RealType, std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits,
00617         -std::numeric_limits<RealType>::min_exponent>();
00618     }
00619     /**
00620      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::FloatU<RealType,prec,erange>().
00621      *
00622      * @return the random double.
00623      **********************************************************************/
00624     double FloatU() throw() { return FloatU<double>(); }
00625 
00626     /**
00627      * Return result is in nearest interval [0,1] by rounding \e u to
00628      * the nearest \ref floating "floating" real.
00629      *
00630      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00631      * @tparam prec the precision of the returned random numbers.
00632      * @tparam erange the exponent range of the returned random numbers.
00633      * @return the random result.
00634      **********************************************************************/
00635     template<typename RealType, int prec, int erange> RealType FloatN()
00636       throw() {
00637       // Use Float or FloatU each with prob 1/2, i.e., return Boolean() ?
00638       // Float() : FloatU().  However, rather than use Boolean(), we pick the
00639       // high bit off a Ran() and pass the rest of the number to FloatZ to use.
00640       // This saves 1/2 a call to Ran().
00641       const result_type x = Generator::Ran();
00642       return x >> (width - 1) ?   // equivalent to Boolean()
00643         // Float<RealType, prec, erange>()
00644         FloatZ<RealType, prec, erange, false>(width - 1, x) :
00645         // FloatU<RealType, prec, erange>()
00646         FloatZ<RealType, prec, erange, true>(width - 1, x);
00647     }
00648     /**
00649      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::FloatN<RealType,prec,erange>().
00650      *
00651      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00652      * @return the random result with the full precision of RealType.
00653      **********************************************************************/
00654     template<typename RealType> RealType FloatN() throw() {
00655       return FloatN<RealType, std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits,
00656         -std::numeric_limits<RealType>::min_exponent>();
00657     }
00658     /**
00659      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::FloatN<RealType,prec,erange>().
00660      *
00661      * @return the random double.
00662      **********************************************************************/
00663     double FloatN() throw() { return FloatN<double>(); }
00664 
00665     /**
00666      * Return result is in wide interval [-1,1], by rounding 2\e u - 1 to the
00667      * nearest \ref floating "floating" real.
00668      *
00669      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00670      * @tparam prec the precision of the returned random numbers.
00671      * @tparam erange the exponent range of the returned random numbers.
00672      * @return the random result.
00673      **********************************************************************/
00674     template<typename RealType, int prec, int erange>
00675     RealType FloatW() throw() {
00676       const result_type x = Generator::Ran();
00677       const int y = int(x >> (width - 2));
00678       return (1 - (y & 2)) *    // Equiv to (Boolean() ? -1 : 1) *
00679         ( y & 1 ?               // equivalent to Boolean()
00680           // Float<RealType, prec, erange>()
00681           FloatZ<RealType, prec, erange, false>(width - 2, x) :
00682           // FloatU<RealType, prec, erange>()
00683           FloatZ<RealType, prec, erange, true>(width - 2, x) );
00684     }
00685     /**
00686      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::FloatW<RealType,prec,erange>().
00687      *
00688      * @tparam RealType the real type of the returned random numbers.
00689      * @return the random result with the full precision of RealType.
00690      **********************************************************************/
00691     template<typename RealType> RealType FloatW() throw() {
00692       return FloatW<RealType, std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits,
00693         -std::numeric_limits<RealType>::min_exponent>();
00694     }
00695     /**
00696      * See documentation for RandomCanonical::FloatW<RealType,prec,erange>().
00697      *
00698      * @return the random double.
00699      **********************************************************************/
00700     double FloatW() throw() { return FloatW<double>(); }
00701     ///@}
00702 
00703     /**
00704      * \name Member functions returning booleans
00705      **********************************************************************/
00706     ///@{
00707     /**
00708      * A coin toss.  Equivalent to RandomCanonical::Integer<bool>().
00709      *
00710      * @return true with probability 1/2.
00711      **********************************************************************/
00712     bool Boolean() throw() { return Generator::Ran() & 1u; }
00713 
00714     /**
00715      * The Bernoulli distribution, true with probability \e p.  False if \e p
00716      * <= 0; true if \e p >= 1.  Equivalent to RandomCanonical::Float() < \e p,
00717      * but typically faster.
00718      *
00719      * @tparam NumericType the type (integer or real) of the argument.
00720      * @param[in] p the probability.
00721      * @return true with probability \e p.
00722      **********************************************************************/
00723     template<typename NumericType> bool Prob(NumericType p) throw();
00724 
00725     /**
00726      * True with probability <i>m</i>/<i>n</i>.  False if \e m <= 0 or \e n <
00727      * 0; true if \e m >= \e n.  With real types, Prob(\e x, \e y) is exact but
00728      * slower than Prob(<i>x</i>/<i>y</i>).
00729      *
00730      * @tparam NumericType the type (integer or real) of the argument.
00731      * @param[in] m the numerator of the probability.
00732      * @param[in] n the denominator of the probability.
00733      * @return true with probability  <i>m</i>/<i>n</i>.
00734      **********************************************************************/
00735     template<typename NumericType>
00736     bool Prob(NumericType m, NumericType n) throw();
00737     ///@}
00738 
00739     // Bits
00740 
00741     /**
00742      * \name Functions returning bitsets
00743      * These return random bits in a std::bitset.
00744      **********************************************************************/
00745     ///@{
00746 
00747     /**
00748      * Return \e nbits random bits
00749      *
00750      * @tparam nbits the number of bits in the bitset.
00751      * @return the random bitset.
00752      **********************************************************************/
00753     template<int nbits> std::bitset<nbits> Bits() throw();
00754 
00755     ///@}
00756 
00757     /**
00758      * A "global" random number generator (not thread-safe!), initialized with
00759      * a fixed seed [].
00760      **********************************************************************/
00761     static RANDOM_EXPORT RandomCanonical Global;
00762 
00763   private:
00764     typedef RandomSeed::u32 u32;
00765     typedef RandomSeed::u64 u64;
00766     /**
00767      * A helper for Integer(\e n).  A random unsigned integer in [0, \e n].  If
00768      * \e n >= 2<sup>32</sup>, this \e must be invoked with \e onep = false.
00769      * Otherwise, it \e should be invoked with \e onep = true.
00770      **********************************************************************/
00771     template<typename UIntT>
00772     typename UIntT::type Unsigned(typename UIntT::type n) throw();
00773 
00774     /**
00775      * A helper for Float and FloatU.  Produces \e up ? FloatU() : Float().  On
00776      * entry the low \e b bits of \e m are usable random bits.
00777      **********************************************************************/
00778     template<typename RealType, int prec, int erange, bool up>
00779     RealType FloatZ(int b, result_type m) throw();
00780 
00781     /**
00782      * The one-argument version of Prob for real types
00783      **********************************************************************/
00784     template<typename RealType> bool ProbF(RealType z) throw();
00785     /**
00786      * The two-argument version of Prob for real types
00787      **********************************************************************/
00788     template<typename RealType> bool ProbF(RealType x, RealType y) throw();
00789   };
00790 
00791   template<class Generator>
00792   RandomCanonical<Generator>::RandomCanonical(seed_type n)
00793     : Generator(n) {
00794     // Compile-time checks on real types
00795 #if HAVE_LONG_DOUBLE
00796     STATIC_ASSERT(std::numeric_limits<float>::radix == 2 &&
00797                   std::numeric_limits<double>::radix == 2 &&
00798                   std::numeric_limits<long double>::radix == 2,
00799                   "RandomCanonical: illegal floating type");
00800     STATIC_ASSERT(0 <= std::numeric_limits<float>::digits &&
00801                   std::numeric_limits<float>::digits <=
00802                   std::numeric_limits<double>::digits &&
00803                   std::numeric_limits<double>::digits <=
00804                   std::numeric_limits<long double>::digits,
00805                   "RandomCanonical: inconsistent floating precision");
00806 #else
00807     STATIC_ASSERT(std::numeric_limits<float>::radix == 2 &&
00808                   std::numeric_limits<double>::radix == 2,
00809                   "RandomCanonical: illegal floating type");
00810     STATIC_ASSERT(0 <= std::numeric_limits<float>::digits &&
00811                   std::numeric_limits<float>::digits <=
00812                   std::numeric_limits<double>::digits,
00813                   "RandomCanonical: inconsistent floating precision");
00814 #endif
00815 #if HAVE_LONG_DOUBLE
00816 #endif
00817 #if RANDOMLIB_POWERTABLE
00818     // checks on power2
00819 #if HAVE_LONG_DOUBLE
00820     STATIC_ASSERT(std::numeric_limits<long double>::digits ==
00821                   RANDOMLIB_LONGDOUBLEPREC,
00822                   "RandomPower2: RANDOMLIB_LONGDOUBLEPREC incorrect");
00823 #else
00824     STATIC_ASSERT(std::numeric_limits<double>::digits ==
00825                   RANDOMLIB_LONGDOUBLEPREC,
00826                   "RandomPower2: RANDOMLIB_LONGDOUBLEPREC incorrect");
00827 #endif
00828     // Make sure table hasn't underflowed
00829     STATIC_ASSERT(RandomPower2::minpow >=
00830                   std::numeric_limits<float>::min_exponent -
00831                   (RANDOMLIB_HASDENORM(float) ?
00832                    std::numeric_limits<float>::digits : 1),
00833                   "RandomPower2 table underflow");
00834     STATIC_ASSERT(RandomPower2::maxpow >= RandomPower2::minpow + 1,
00835                   "RandomPower2 table empty");
00836     // Needed by RandomCanonical::Fixed<long double>()
00837 #if HAVE_LONG_DOUBLE
00838     STATIC_ASSERT(RandomPower2::minpow <=
00839                   -std::numeric_limits<long double>::digits,
00840                   "RandomPower2 minpow not small enough for long double");
00841 #else
00842     STATIC_ASSERT(RandomPower2::minpow <=
00843                   -std::numeric_limits<double>::digits,
00844                   "RandomPower2 minpow not small enough for double");
00845 #endif
00846     // Needed by ProbF
00847     STATIC_ASSERT(RandomPower2::maxpow - width >= 0,
00848                   "RandomPower2 maxpow not large enough for ProbF");
00849 #endif
00850     // Needed for RandomCanonical::Bits()
00851     STATIC_ASSERT(2 * std::numeric_limits<unsigned long>::digits - width >= 0,
00852                   "Bits<n>(): unsigned long too small");
00853   }
00854 
00855   template<class Generator> template<typename IntType>
00856   inline IntType RandomCanonical<Generator>::Integer() throw() {
00857     // A random integer of type IntType in [min(IntType), max(IntType)].
00858     STATIC_ASSERT(std::numeric_limits<IntType>::is_integer &&
00859                   std::numeric_limits<IntType>::radix == 2,
00860                   "Integer: bad integer type IntType");
00861     const int d = std::numeric_limits<IntType>::digits +
00862       std::numeric_limits<IntType>::is_signed; // Include the sign bit
00863     // Check that we have enough digits in Ran64
00864     STATIC_ASSERT(d > 0 && d <= 64, "Integer: bad bit-size");
00865     if (d <= width)
00866       return IntType(Generator::Ran());
00867     else                        // d <= 64
00868       return IntType(Generator::Ran64());
00869   }
00870 
00871   template<class Generator> template<typename UIntT>
00872   inline typename UIntT::type
00873   RandomCanonical<Generator>::Unsigned(typename UIntT::type n) throw() {
00874     // A random unsigned in [0, n].  In n fits in 32-bits, call with UIntType =
00875     // u32 and onep = true else call with UIntType = u64 and onep = false.
00876     // There are a few cases (e.g., n = 0x80000000) where on a 64-bit machine
00877     // with a 64-bit Generator it would be quicker to call this with UIntType =
00878     // result_type and invoke Ran().  However this speed advantage disappears
00879     // if the argument isn't a compile time constant.
00880     //
00881     // Special case n == 0 is handled by the callers of Unsigned.  The
00882     // following is to guard against a division by 0 in the return statement
00883     // (but it shouldn't happen).
00884     n = n ? n : 1U;             // n >= 1
00885     // n1 = n + 1, but replace overflowed value by 1.  Overflow occurs, e.g.,
00886     // when n = u32::mask and then we have r1 = 0, m = u32::mask.
00887     const typename UIntT::type n1 = ~n ? n + 1U : 1U;
00888     // "Ratio method".  Find m = r * n1 - 1, s.t., 0 < (q - n1 ) < m <= q,
00889     // where q = max(UIntType), and sample in u in [0, m] and return u / r.  If
00890     // onep then we use Ran32() else Rand64().
00891     const typename UIntT::type
00892       // r = floor((q + 1)/n1), r1 = r - 1, avoiding overflow.  Actually
00893       // overflow can occur if std::numeric_limits<u32>::digits == 64, because
00894       // then we can have onep && n > U32_MASK.  This is however ruled out by
00895       // the callers to Unsigned.  (If Unsigned is called in this way, the
00896       // results are bogus, but there is no error condition.)
00897       r1 = ((UIntT::width == 32 ? typename UIntT::type(u32::mask) :
00898              typename UIntT::type(u64::mask)) - n) / n1,
00899       m = r1 * n1 + n;          // m = r * n1 - 1, avoiding overflow
00900     // Here r1 in [0, (q-1)/2], m in [(q+1)/2, q]
00901     typename UIntT::type u;     // Find a random number in [0, m]
00902     do
00903       // For small n1, this is executed once (since m is nearly q).  In the
00904       // worst case the loop is executed slightly less than twice on average.
00905       u = UIntT::width == 32 ? typename UIntT::type(Generator::Ran32()) :
00906         typename UIntT::type(Generator::Ran64());
00907     while (u > m);
00908     // Now u is in [0, m] = [0, r * n1), so u / r is in [0, n1) = [0, n].  An
00909     // alternative unbiased method would be u % n1; but / appears to be faster.
00910     return u / (r1 + 1U);
00911   }
00912 
00913   template<class Generator> template<typename IntType>
00914   inline IntType RandomCanonical<Generator>::Integer(IntType n) throw() {
00915     // A random integer of type IntType in [0, n).  If n == 0, treat as
00916     // max(IntType) + 1.  If n < 0, treat as 1 and return 0.
00917     // N.B. Integer<IntType>(0) is equivalent to Integer<IntType>() for
00918     // unsigned types.  For signed types, the former returns a non-negative
00919     // result and the latter returns a result in the full range.
00920     STATIC_ASSERT(std::numeric_limits<IntType>::is_integer &&
00921                   std::numeric_limits<IntType>::radix == 2,
00922                   "Integer(n): bad integer type IntType");
00923     const int d = std::numeric_limits<IntType>::digits;
00924     // Check that we have enough digits in Ran64
00925     STATIC_ASSERT(d > 0 && d <= 64, "Integer(n): bad bit-size");
00926     return n > IntType(1) ?
00927       (d <= 32 || n - 1 <= IntType(u32::mask) ?
00928        IntType(Unsigned<u32>(u32::type(n - 1))) :
00929        IntType(Unsigned<u64>(u64::type(n - 1)))) :
00930       ( n ? IntType(0) :        // n == 1 || n < 0
00931         Integer<IntType, d>()); // n == 0
00932   }
00933 
00934   template<class Generator> template<typename IntType>
00935   inline IntType RandomCanonical<Generator>::IntegerC(IntType n) throw() {
00936     // A random integer of type IntType in [0, n]
00937     STATIC_ASSERT(std::numeric_limits<IntType>::is_integer &&
00938                   std::numeric_limits<IntType>::radix == 2,
00939                   "IntegerC(n): bad integer type IntType");
00940     const int d = std::numeric_limits<IntType>::digits;
00941     // Check that we have enough digits in Ran64
00942     STATIC_ASSERT(d > 0 && d <= 64, "IntegerC(n): bad bit-size");
00943     return n > IntType(0) ?
00944       (d <= 32 || n <= IntType(u32::mask) ?
00945        IntType(Unsigned<u32>(u32::type(n))) :
00946        IntType(Unsigned<u64>(u64::type(n))))
00947       : IntType(0);             // n <= 0
00948   }
00949 
00950   template<class Generator> template<typename IntType>
00951   inline IntType RandomCanonical<Generator>::IntegerC(IntType m, IntType n)
00952     throw() {
00953     // A random integer of type IntType in [m, n]
00954     STATIC_ASSERT(std::numeric_limits<IntType>::is_integer &&
00955                   std::numeric_limits<IntType>::radix == 2,
00956                   "IntegerC(m,n): bad integer type IntType");
00957     const int d = std::numeric_limits<IntType>::digits +
00958       std::numeric_limits<IntType>::is_signed; // Include sign bit
00959     // Check that we have enough digits in Ran64
00960     STATIC_ASSERT(d > 0 && d <= 64, "IntegerC(m,n): bad bit-size");
00961     // The unsigned subtraction, n - m, avoids the underflow that is possible
00962     // in the signed operation.
00963     return m + (n <= m ? 0 :
00964                 d <= 32 ?
00965                 IntType(IntegerC<u32::type>(u32::type(n) - u32::type(m))) :
00966                 IntType(IntegerC<u64::type>(u64::type(n) - u64::type(m))));
00967   }
00968 
00969   template<class Generator>
00970   template<typename RealType, int prec, int erange, bool up> inline
00971   RealType RandomCanonical<Generator>::FloatZ(int b, result_type m) throw() {
00972     // Produce up ? FloatU() : Float().  On entry the low b bits of m are
00973     // usable random bits.
00974     STATIC_ASSERT(!std::numeric_limits<RealType>::is_integer &&
00975                   std::numeric_limits<RealType>::radix == 2,
00976                   "FloatZ: bad real type RealType");
00977     STATIC_ASSERT(prec > 0 && prec <= std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits,
00978                   "FloatZ: invalid precision");
00979     STATIC_ASSERT(erange >= 0, "FloatZ: invalid exponent range");
00980     // With subnormals: condition that smallest number is representable
00981     STATIC_ASSERT(!RANDOMLIB_HASDENORM(RealType) ||
00982                   // Need 1/2^(erange+prec) > 0
00983                   prec + erange <= std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits -
00984                   std::numeric_limits<RealType>::min_exponent,
00985                   "FloatZ: smallest number cannot be represented");
00986     // Without subnormals :condition for no underflow in while loop
00987     STATIC_ASSERT(RANDOMLIB_HASDENORM(RealType) ||
00988                   // Need 1/2^(erange+1) > 0
00989                   erange <= - std::numeric_limits<RealType>::min_exponent,
00990                   "FloatZ: underflow possible");
00991 
00992     // Simpler (but slower) version of FloatZ.  However this method cannot
00993     // handle the full range of exponents and, in addition, is slower on
00994     // average.
00995     // template<typename RealType, int prec, int erange, bool up>
00996     // RealType FloatZ() {
00997     //   RealType x = Fixed<RealType, erange + 1>();
00998     //   int s;         // Determine exponent (-erange <= s <= 0)
00999     //   frexp(x, &s);      // Prob(s) = 2^(s-1)
01000     //   // Scale number in [1,2) by 2^(s-1).  If x == 0 scale number in [0,1).
01001     //   return ((up ? FixedU<RealType, prec - 1>() :
01002     //            Fixed<RealType, prec - 1>()) + (x ? 1 : 0)) *
01003     //     RandomPower2::pow2<RealType>(s - 1);
01004     // }
01005     //
01006     // Use {a, b} to denote the inteval: up ? (a, b] : [a, b)
01007     //
01008     // The code produces the number as
01009     //
01010     // Interval             count       prob = spacing
01011     // {1,2} / 2            2^(prec-1)  1/2^prec
01012     // {1,2} / 2^s          2^(prec-1)  1/2^(prec+s-1)      for s = 2..erange+1
01013     // {0,1} / 2^(erange+1) 2^(prec-1)  1/2^(prec+erange)
01014 
01015     // Generate prec bits in {0, 1}
01016     RealType x = up ? FixedU<RealType, prec>() : Fixed<RealType, prec>();
01017     // Use whole interval if erange == 0 and handle the interval {1/2, 1}
01018     if (erange == 0 || (up ? x > RealType(0.5) : x >= RealType(0.5)))
01019       return x;
01020     x += RealType(0.5);         // Shift remaining portion to {1/2, 1}
01021     if (b == 0) {
01022       m = Generator::Ran();     // Random bits
01023       b = width;                // Bits available in m
01024     }
01025     int sm = erange;            // sm = erange - s + 2
01026     // Here x in {1, 2} / 2, prob 1/2
01027     do {                        // s = 2 thru erange+1, sm = erange thru 1
01028       x /= 2;
01029       if (m & 1u)
01030         return x;               // x in {1, 2} / 2^s, prob 1/2^s
01031       if (--b)
01032         m >>= 1;
01033       else {
01034         m = Generator::Ran();
01035         b = width;
01036       }
01037     } while (--sm);
01038     // x in {1, 2} / 2^(erange+1), prob 1/2^(erange+1).  Don't worry about the
01039     // possible overhead of the calls to pow here.  We rarely get here.
01040     if (RANDOMLIB_HASDENORM(RealType) || // subnormals allowed
01041         // No subnormals but smallest number still representable
01042         prec + erange <= -std::numeric_limits<RealType>::min_exponent + 1 ||
01043         // Possibility of underflow, so have to test on x.  Here, we have -prec
01044         // + 1 < erange + min_exp <= 0 so pow2 can be used
01045         x >= (RealType(1) +
01046               RandomPower2::pow2<RealType>
01047               (erange + std::numeric_limits<RealType>::min_exponent)) *
01048         (erange + 1 > -RandomPower2::minpow ?
01049          std::pow(RealType(2), - erange - 1) :
01050          RandomPower2::pow2<RealType>(- erange - 1)))
01051       // shift x to {0, 1} / 2^(erange+1)
01052       // Use product of pow's since max(erange + 1) =
01053       // std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits -
01054       // std::numeric_limits<RealType>::min_exponent and pow may underflow
01055       return x -
01056         (erange + 1 > -RandomPower2::minpow ?
01057          std::pow(RealType(2), -(erange + 1)/2) *
01058          std::pow(RealType(2), -(erange + 1) + (erange + 1)/2) :
01059          RandomPower2::pow2<RealType>(- erange - 1));
01060     else
01061       return up ?               // Underflow to up ? min() : 0
01062         // pow is OK here.
01063         std::pow(RealType(2), std::numeric_limits<RealType>::min_exponent - 1)
01064         : RealType(0);
01065   }
01066 
01067   /// \cond SKIP
01068   // True with probability n.  Since n is an integer this is equivalent to n >
01069   // 0.
01070   template<class Generator> template<typename IntType>
01071   inline bool RandomCanonical<Generator>::Prob(IntType n) throw() {
01072     STATIC_ASSERT(std::numeric_limits<IntType>::is_integer,
01073                   "Prob(n): invalid integer type IntType");
01074     return n > 0;
01075   }
01076   /// \endcond
01077 
01078   // True with probability p.  true if p >= 1, false if p <= 0 or isnan(p).
01079   template<class Generator> template<typename RealType>
01080   inline bool RandomCanonical<Generator>::ProbF(RealType p) throw() {
01081     // Simulate Float<RealType>() < p.  The definition involves < (instead of
01082     // <=) because Float<RealType>() is in [0,1) so it is "biased downwards".
01083     // Instead of calling Float<RealType>(), we generate only as many bits as
01084     // necessary to determine the result.  This makes the routine considerably
01085     // faster than Float<RealType>() < x even for type float.  Compared with
01086     // the inexact Fixed<RealType>() < p, this is about 20% slower with floats
01087     // and 20% faster with doubles and long doubles.
01088     STATIC_ASSERT(!std::numeric_limits<RealType>::is_integer &&
01089                   std::numeric_limits<RealType>::radix == 2,
01090                   "ProbF(p): invalid real type RealType");
01091     // Generate Real() c bits at a time where c is chosen so that cast doesn't
01092     // loose any bits and so that it uses up just one rv.
01093     const int c = std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits > width ?
01094       width : std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits;
01095     STATIC_ASSERT(c > 0, "ProbF(p): Illegal chunk size");
01096     const RealType mult = RandomPower2::pow2<RealType>(c);
01097     // A recursive definition:
01098     //
01099     // return p > RealType(0) &&
01100     //   (p >= RealType(1) ||
01101     //    ProbF(mult * p - RealType(Integer<result_type, c>())));
01102     //
01103     // Pre-loop tests needed to avoid overflow
01104     if (!(p > RealType(0)))     // Ensure false if isnan(p)
01105       return false;
01106     else if (p >= RealType(1))
01107       return true;
01108     do {                        // Loop executed slightly more than once.
01109       // Here p is in (0,1).  Write Fixed() = (X + y)/mult where X is an
01110       // integer in [0, mult) and y is a real in [0,1).  Then Fixed() < p
01111       // becomes p' > y where p' = p * mult - X.
01112       p *= mult;                // Form p'.  Multiplication is exact
01113       p -= RealType(Integer<result_type, c>()); // Also exact
01114       if (p <= RealType(0))
01115         return false;           // If p' <= 0 the result is definitely false.
01116       // Exit if p' >= 1; the result is definitely true.  Otherwise p' is in
01117       // (0,1) and the result is true with probability p'.
01118     } while (p < RealType(1));
01119     return true;
01120   }
01121 
01122   /// \cond SKIP
01123   // True with probability m/n (ratio of integers)
01124   template<class Generator> template<typename IntType>
01125   inline bool RandomCanonical<Generator>::Prob(IntType m, IntType n) throw() {
01126     STATIC_ASSERT(std::numeric_limits<IntType>::is_integer,
01127                   "Prob(m,n): invalid integer type IntType");
01128     // Test n >= 0 without triggering compiler warning when n = unsigned
01129     return m > 0 && (n > 0 || n == 0) && (m >= n || Integer<IntType>(n) < m);
01130   }
01131   /// \endcond
01132 
01133   // True with probability x/y (ratio of reals)
01134   template<class Generator> template<typename RealType>
01135   inline bool RandomCanonical<Generator>::ProbF(RealType x, RealType y)
01136     throw() {
01137     STATIC_ASSERT(!std::numeric_limits<RealType>::is_integer &&
01138                   std::numeric_limits<RealType>::radix == 2,
01139                   "ProbF(x,y): invalid real type RealType");
01140     if (!(x > RealType(0) && y >= RealType(0))) // Do the trivial cases
01141       return false;             // Also if either x or y is a nan
01142     else if (x >= y)
01143       return true;
01144     // Now 0 < x < y
01145     int ex, ey;                 // Extract exponents
01146     x = std::frexp(x, &ex);
01147     y = std::frexp(y, &ey);
01148     // Now 0.5 <= x,y < 1
01149     if (x > y) {
01150       x *= RealType(0.5);
01151       ++ex;
01152     }
01153     int s = ey - ex;
01154     // Now 0.25 < x < y < 1, s >= 0, 0.5 < x/y <= 1
01155     // Return true with prob 2^-s * x/y
01156     while (s > 0) {             // With prob 1 - 2^-s return false
01157       // Check the next min(s, width) bits.
01158       if (Generator::Ran() >> (s > width ? 0 : width - s))
01159         return false;
01160       s -= width;
01161     }
01162     // Here with prob 2^-s
01163     const int c = std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits > width ?
01164       width : std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits;
01165     STATIC_ASSERT(c > 0, "ProbF(x,y): invalid chunk size");
01166     const RealType mult = RandomPower2::pow2<RealType>(c);
01167     // Generate infinite precision z = Real().
01168     // As soon as we know z > y, start again
01169     // As soon as we know z < x, return true
01170     // As soon as we know x < z < y, return false
01171     while (true) {              // Loop executed 1/x on average
01172       double xa = x, ya = y;
01173       while (true) {            // Loop executed slightly more than once
01174         // xa <= ya, ya > 0, xa < 1.
01175         // Here (xa,ya) are in (0,1).  Write Fixed() = (X + y)/mult where X is
01176         // an integer in [0, mult) and y is a real in [0,1).  Then Fixed() < z
01177         // becomes z' > y where z' = z * mult - X.
01178         const RealType d = RealType(Integer<result_type, c>());
01179         if (ya < RealType(1)) {
01180           ya *= mult;           // Form ya'
01181           ya -= d;
01182           if (ya <= RealType(0))
01183             break;              // z > y, start again
01184         }
01185         if (xa > RealType(0)) {
01186           xa *= mult;           // From xa'
01187           xa -= d;
01188           if (xa >= RealType(1))
01189             return true;        // z < x
01190         }
01191         if (xa <= RealType(0) && ya >= RealType(1))
01192           return false;         // x < z < y
01193       }
01194     }
01195   }
01196 
01197   template<class Generator> template<int nbits>
01198   inline std::bitset<nbits> RandomCanonical<Generator>::Bits() throw() {
01199     // Return nbits random bits
01200     STATIC_ASSERT(nbits >= 0, "Bits<n>(): invalid nbits");
01201     const int ulbits = std::numeric_limits<bitset_uint_t>::digits;
01202     STATIC_ASSERT(2 * ulbits >= width,
01203                   "Bits<n>(): integer constructor type too narrow");
01204     std::bitset<nbits> b;
01205     int m = nbits;
01206 
01207     while (m > 0) {
01208       result_type x = Generator::Ran();
01209       if (m < nbits)
01210         b <<= (width > ulbits ? width - ulbits : width);
01211       if (width > ulbits &&     // x doesn't fit into a bitset_uint_t
01212           // But on the first time through the loop the most significant bits
01213           // may not be needed.
01214           (nbits > ((nbits-1)/width) * width + ulbits || m < nbits)) {
01215         // Handle most significant width - ulbits bits.
01216         b |= (bitset_uint_t)(x >> (width > ulbits ? ulbits : 0));
01217         b <<= ulbits;
01218       }
01219       // Bitsets can be constructed from a bitset_uint_t.
01220       b |= (bitset_uint_t)(x);
01221       m -= width;
01222     }
01223     return b;
01224   }
01225   /// \cond SKIP
01226 
01227   // The specialization of Integer<bool> is required because bool(int) in the
01228   // template definition will test for non-zeroness instead of returning the
01229   // low bit.
01230 #if HAVE_LONG_DOUBLE
01231 #define RANDOMCANONICAL_SPECIALIZE(RandomType)              \
01232   template<> template<>                                     \
01233   inline bool RandomType::Integer<bool>()                   \
01234     throw() { return Boolean(); }                           \
01235   RANDOMCANONICAL_SPECIALIZE_PROB(RandomType, float)        \
01236   RANDOMCANONICAL_SPECIALIZE_PROB(RandomType, double)       \
01237   RANDOMCANONICAL_SPECIALIZE_PROB(RandomType, long double)
01238 #else
01239 #define RANDOMCANONICAL_SPECIALIZE(RandomType)              \
01240   template<> template<>                                     \
01241   inline bool RandomType::Integer<bool>()                   \
01242     throw() { return Boolean(); }                           \
01243   RANDOMCANONICAL_SPECIALIZE_PROB(RandomType, float)        \
01244   RANDOMCANONICAL_SPECIALIZE_PROB(RandomType, double)
01245 #endif
01246 
01247   // Connect Prob(p) with ProbF(p) for all real types
01248   // Connect Prob(x, y) with ProbF(x, y) for all real types
01249 #define RANDOMCANONICAL_SPECIALIZE_PROB(RandomType, RealType)       \
01250   template<> template<>                                             \
01251   inline bool RandomType::Prob<RealType>(RealType p)                \
01252     throw() { return ProbF<RealType>(p); }                          \
01253   template<> template<>                                             \
01254   inline bool RandomType::Prob<RealType>(RealType x, RealType y)    \
01255     throw() { return ProbF<RealType>(x, y); }
01256 
01257   RANDOMCANONICAL_SPECIALIZE(RandomCanonical<MRandomGenerator32>)
01258   RANDOMCANONICAL_SPECIALIZE(RandomCanonical<MRandomGenerator64>)
01259   RANDOMCANONICAL_SPECIALIZE(RandomCanonical<SRandomGenerator32>)
01260   RANDOMCANONICAL_SPECIALIZE(RandomCanonical<SRandomGenerator64>)
01261 
01262 #undef RANDOMCANONICAL_SPECIALIZE
01263 #undef RANDOMCANONICAL_SPECIALIZE_PROB

01267   /**
01268    * Hook XRandomNN to XRandomGeneratorNN
01269    **********************************************************************/
01270   typedef RandomCanonical<MRandomGenerator32> MRandom32;
01271   typedef RandomCanonical<MRandomGenerator64> MRandom64;
01272   typedef RandomCanonical<SRandomGenerator32> SRandom32;
01273   typedef RandomCanonical<SRandomGenerator64> SRandom64;

01276 namespace std {
01277   /**
01278    * Swap two RandomCanonicals.  This is about 3x faster than the default swap.
01279    **********************************************************************/
01280   template<class Generator>
01281   void swap(RandomLib::RandomCanonical<Generator>& r,
01282             RandomLib::RandomCanonical<Generator>& s) throw() {
01283     r.swap(s);
01284   }
